intro: Razoumofskya vaginata, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a distinctive velvety texture. Razoumofskya vaginata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
